casebody.data:
Lydia E. Defrees et al., Appellees, v. Robert T. Brydon, Appellant.Gen. No. 20,939.

(Not to be reported in full.)

Appeal from the Circuit Court of Cook county; the Hon. Lookwood Honore, Judge, presiding. Heard in the Branch Appellate Court at the October term, 1914.Reversed and remanded with directions.Opinion filed March 9, 1916.

Statement of the Case.

Bill by Lydia Defrees et al., complainants, against Robert T. Brydon, defendant. From a judgment for complainants, defendant appeals.

This case is governed by the opinion in Defrees v. Brydon, ante, p. 265, and the decree is accordingly reversed and the cause remanded with directions to dismiss the bill and amended and supplemental bill of complainant for want of equity.

John E. Foster, for appellant.Fyffe, Ryner & Dale and William France Anderson, for appellees; Colin C. H. Fyffe, of counsel. Mr. Justice McGoorty

delivered the opinion of the court.
